resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: This work is a small-scale reproduction of At the School Door, a plaster sculpture Falguière realized in 1887. The original work is exhibited at the Musée des Augustins in Toulouse.
resource.chars: This work is a small-scale reproduction of At the School Door, a plaster sculpture Falguière realized in 1887. The original work is exhibited at the Musée des Augustins in Toulouse.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Alexandre Falguière, Portrait of Léon Gambetta, 1884. After the death of Gambetta, the government organized a contest for a commemorative monument. Falguière entered the contest with this bust of Gambetta. A porcelain version of the bust was produced by the Manufacture de Sèvre between 1897 and 1933.
resource.chars:
Alexandre Falguière, Portrait of Léon Gambetta, 1884.

After the death of Gambetta, the government organized a contest for a commemorative monument. Falguière entered the contest with this bust of Gambetta. A porcelain version of the bust was produced by the Manufacture de Sèvre between 1897 and 1933.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Alexandre Falguière, Bacchantes Fighting, c. 1886, plaster (France, Paris, Petit Palais). Falguière represented this subject of the Bacchantes in a painting, currently exhibited in the Orsay Museum.
resource.chars:
Alexandre Falguière, Bacchantes Fighting, c. 1886, plaster (France, Paris, Petit Palais).

Falguière represented this subject of the Bacchantes in a painting, currently exhibited in the Orsay Museum.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M954.38703,847.07662h-451.20138v0h-451.20138v-388.88212v-388.88212h451.20138h451.20138v388.88212z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"rotation":0,"annotation":null,"nonHoverStrokeColor":["Color",1,0,1],"editable":true}" id="rectangle_48bfa581-519f-46cc-a255-4c6c125d73aa" fill-opacity="0.00001" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#ff00ff" stroke-width="16.50295" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Alexandre Falguière (1831–1900) was a French sculptor and painter. After a traditional academic training, he taught at the Académie des beaux-arts, and received numerous requests for commemorative monuments from the French government. As a sculptor, his studio is located on the ground floor, with enough space to circulate around his work. Bénard's photograph represents Falguière absorbed in his work, browsing through a portfolio while working on his Bacchantes Fighting, exhibited during the Salon of 1886: the scene seems unposed, and Falguière chose, in his studio, to highlight his work as a prominent sculptor. Auguste Rodin, Alexandre Falguière, 1897, bronze (France, Paris, Rodin Museum).
resource.chars:
Alexandre Falguière (1831–1900) was a French sculptor and painter. After a traditional academic training, he taught at the Académie des beaux-arts, and received numerous requests for commemorative monuments from the French government.

As a sculptor, his studio is located on the ground floor, with enough space to circulate around his work. Bénard's photograph represents Falguière absorbed in his work, browsing through a portfolio while working on his Bacchantes Fighting, exhibited during the Salon of 1886: the scene seems unposed, and Falguière chose, in his studio, to highlight his work as a prominent sculptor.

Auguste Rodin, Alexandre Falguière, 1897, bronze (France, Paris, Rodin Museum).
